gurmukhi: ibs ky nwm aucwir kY ibK pd bhur bKwn ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky lIjo cqur pCwn ]108]
transliteration: Bis Ke Naam Oucdaar(i) Kai Bikh Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Leejo Chatur Pachhaad||108||
translation: Uttering the names of “Vish” (poison) and then adding the word “Vish” again, all the names of Baan are recognized.108.

gurmukhi: kwnI nwm bKwn kY Dr pd bhur bKwn ]ihrdy smJhu cqur qum skl nwm ey bwn ]110]
transliteration: Baa Pad Pritham Bakhaan Kai Poun(i) Nakaar Pad Deh(u)|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Jaan Chatur Chit Leh(u)||109||
translation: Speaking the syllable “B” in the beginning and then adding the syllable “N”, the wise people comprehend the names of Baan.109.

gurmukhi: Pok Sbd piRKmY aucir Dr pd bhuro dyhu ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky cqur hiRdY liK lyhu ]111]
transliteration: Kaaninaam Bakhaan Kai Dhar Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Hirde Samjhoh Chatur Toum Sakal Naam E Baan||110||
translation: Speaking the word “Kani” and then saying saving the word “Dhar”, the wise people comprehend the names of Baan in their mind.110.

gurmukhi: psupiq pRQm bKwin kY Asur Sbd puin dyhu ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky ic`q cqur liK lyhu ]112]
transliteration: Phok Shabad Prithmai Ouchar(i) Dhar Pad Bahuro Deh(u)|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Chatur Hridai Lakh(i) Leh(u)||111||
translation: Uttering the word “Phok” in the beginning and then adding the word “Dhar”, all the names of Baan can be comprehended in mind.111.

gurmukhi: shs nwm iSv ky aucir Asur Sbd puin dyhu ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky cqur cIn icq lyhu ]113]
transliteration: Pasepat(i) Pratham Bakhaan(i) Kai Asur Shabad Poun(i) Deh(u)|| Naam Sakal Baan Ke Chitt Chatur Lakh(i) Leh(u)||112||
translation: Saying the word “Pashupati” primarily and then adding the word “Asur”, the wise people comprehend all the names of Baan in their mind.112.

gurmukhi: piRQm krn ky nwm kih puin Air Sbd bKwn ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky lIjo cqur pCwn ]114]
transliteration: Sahas Naam Shiv Ke Ouchar(i) Asur Shabad Poun(i) Deh(u)|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Chatur Cheen Chit Leh(i)||113||
translation: Uttering one thousand names of Shiva and then speaking the word “Asur” all the names of Baan are known.113.

gurmukhi: Bwnu jwq krnwNq kr AYsI BwNiq bKwn ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky cqur lIjIAhu jwn ]115]
transliteration: Pritham Karan Ke Naam Kah(i) Poun(i) Ar(u) Shabad Bakhaan|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Leejo Chatur Pachhaad||114||
translation: Saying primarily all the names of “Karan” and then adding “Ari” all the names of “Karan” and then adding “Ari” all the names of Baan are recognized.114.

gurmukhi: sB Arjun ky nwm kih AwXuD Sbd bKwn ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky lIjhu cqur pCwn ]116]
transliteration: Bhaan(u) Jaat Karnaant Kar Aisibhaant(i) Bakhaan|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Chatur Leejeeauh Jaan||115
translation: Uttering the destroyer of Karan, the son of sun, all the names of Baan are known.115.

gurmukhi: ijsn DnMjY kiRSn Bin syvq Ais lY nwih ]AwXuD bhur bKwnIAhu sBY bwn huie jwih ]117]
transliteration: Jisan Dhananjai Krishan Bhan(i) Sevat As(i) Lai Naah(i)|| Aayudh Bahur Bakhaaniauh Sabhai Baan Hoe Jaah(i)||117||
translation: Uttering all the names of Arjun and then adding the word “Aayudh”, all the names all the word mean “Baan”.117.

gurmukhi: Arjun pwrQ kysguV swcI sBY bKwn ]AwXuD bhur bKwnIAY nwm bwn ky jwn ]118]
transliteration: Arjoun Paarath Kesgud Saachisabhai Bakhaan|| Aayudh Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Ke Jaan||118||
translation: Uttering the words “Arjun, Parath, Kesgur, Sanchi etc. and then adding the word “Aayudh”, the names of Baan are known.118.

gurmukhi: ibjY kpIDuj jYdRQir sUrj jir Pun BwKu ]AwXuD bhur bKwnIAY nwm bwn liK rwKu ]119]
transliteration: Bijai Kapeedhuj Jaidratharisooraj Jar(i) Phoun Bhaakh(u)|| Aayudh Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Lakh(i) Raakh(u)||119
translation: Uttering the worlds “Kapidhvaj, Jaidrathari, Surya, Jari” and then adding the word “Aayudh”, the names of Baan are known.119.

gurmukhi: iqmrir bl biRq inschw kih sq bhur aucwr ]AwXuD aucr sRI bwn ky inksih nwm Apwr ]120]
transliteration: Timrar(i) Bal Brit Nischahaa Kah(i) Sat Bahur Ouchaar|| Aayudh Ouchar Sribaan Ke Niksah(i) Naam Apaar||120||
translation: After saying the words “Timiraari, Bal Vrat, Nishichar-Naashak”, and then adding the word “Shat” and afterwards adding “Aayudh”, many names of Baan continue to be evolved.120.

gurmukhi: shsR ibSn ky nwm lY Anuj Sbd kO dyhu ]qnj aucir puin SsqR kih nwmu bwn liK lyhu ]121]
transliteration: Sahsra Bishan Ke Naam Lai Anuj Shabad Kau Deh(u)|| Tanaj Ouchar(i) Poun(i) Shastra Kah(i) Naam(u) Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||
translation: Uttering one thousand names of Vishnu and then adding the words “Anuj, Tanuj and Shastar” in serial order, the names of Baan are visulised.121.
